Log out of the account on all devices except the current one. Set a passcode on Telegram.
Can't log in, the password doesn't work anymore
If attackers have changed the password and you cannot log into your Telegram account, you need to act quickly to regain control. Here's what to do:
Restore access via phone number
Telegram is tied to your phone number, so you can restore access to your account by following these steps: 1. Open Telegram and enter your phone number. 2. You will receive
SMS confirmation code
or via a call. Use this code to log in. 3. If the attackers enabled two-factor authentication (cloud password), Telegram will request it. In this case, proceed to the next step.
Contact Telegram support
If you cannot bypass the cloud password, you will need to write to the support service: 1. Go to the Telegram support page: [Telegram Support]

2. In the message, specify: - Your phone number in international format (+380... for Ukraine). - The time and date when you last had access to the account. - Description of the problem (for example: *'My account was hacked and the password was changed without my knowledge'*).
Important:
Telegram can only help if you can verify the phone number associated with the account.
Complete the activity of other sessions

If you managed to restore access:
- Open
Settings
Devices
Close all sessions except the current one by clicking
Close all other sessions
Translate this text to English
4. Enable account protection

1. Enable two-factor authentication:
   - Go to
Settings
Hello, how are you?
Privacy and security
Hello, how are you?
Two-factor authentication

1. Set a new password.
2. Check if the correct email is linked to your account. If attackers have changed it, correct the address.
5. If nothing helps

If restoring access is not possible: 1. Try to create a new account with the same phone number. - If the attackers deleted your account, you will be able to create a new one. 2. Warn your contacts that your old account has been hacked so they do not respond to suspicious messages.
Additional protection
Hello, how are you today?
Change the passwords on other accounts associated with Telegram.
For example, to Google or email, if Telegram used them for verification.
Update the software and check the devices for viruses.
Thanks to quick actions, you will be able to minimize damage and protect your information.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: December 15 and 22 are shopping Sundays in Poland

Already this Sunday, December 15, all shops and supermarkets in Poland will be open. This will allow better preparation for the holidays and shopping on a day off. The next Sunday, December 22, will also be a trading day.
will fall on Wednesday and Thursday (December 25 and 26). If you want to rest during the festive period, you should take leave on December 23, 24, 27, 30, and 31.
How and when did shopping Sundays appear in Poland?
the term that means on a certain Sunday of the year grocery stores, supermarkets, shopping centers and

Throughout Poland, stores operate on a regular schedule. However, on other holidays and Sundays, there is a law prohibiting trade.

This restriction was introduced because workers prefer to rest on the seventh day of the week and spend it with their families. A similar law exists in other EU countries, such as Germany, Austria, Switzerland, France, Finland, Spain, and Portugal.

The ban on Sunday trading in Poland was gradually introduced starting in 2018. In the first year after the law came into force, shops were open two Sundays a month. A year later, the number decreased to one Sunday a month. As of 2024, shopping can only be done on government-designated days.

I will try to explain my distrust of the statements made by Konstantin/Victoria. Lufthansa is a regular carrier. It is obliged to fly as much as it has declared. That is, if 3 flights from Munich to Krakow are announced for the season, it is obliged to perform them according to its status. Plane breakdown, fog - means it changes the plane, waits or departs from another airport where it transports passengers by other means. Regular carriers do not cancel flights - for this their aviation management severely fines them up to the loss of status. But low-cost carriers - they can cancel. Sold few tickets, not profitable for them - they canceled the flight. Therefore, the statement that a regular carrier canceled a bunch of flights is very interesting to me and I would like to check it for truthfulness.

As for Kiwi, it's some shady operation that sells tickets on all lines, even those that don't cooperate with them. I suspect they use sales channels for tour operators. That's why there are no proper tickets or registration data ‚Äì nothing. In fact, it's a flight being sold, not a ticket for a plane. And here come all the consequences ‚Äì unexpected overbookings (which I actually love), payment issues with the airline, and unclear flight cancellations by Kiwi itself, not the carrier. But yes, it's sometimes a couple of bucks cheaper.

In addition, they may ask for return tickets or even the contact and address of the person you are visiting. But in fact, such questions are not often asked. Whether to take the risk is up to you. However, if they do not let you in, they will turn you back and stamp a letter either E or G.
What do these letters E or G on the stamp mean?
We bought at Tunetska, there is a small garden center, last year in Castorama, all major building centers have it.
"E" - lack of documents proving the purpose of your trip. The name of such a document must be specified. "G" - used to indicate a lack of funds (cash and/or card).

Depending on the degree of kinship, a certain list of documents must be provided:

‚óè If a child is traveling with one of the parents or guardians.

In a state of martial law, a notarized consent from the other parent is not required; it is sufficient to have the original birth certificate of the child with you.

‚óè When leaving with close relatives ‚Äì grandmother, grandfather, stepmother, stepfather, or adult brothers or sisters.

The original birth certificate of the child and documents confirming the family ties (not notarized). Parental permission for departure is also not required.

‚óè Persons who are not relatives.

If the child is traveling abroad with a third party, a written statement from one of the parents (must be certified by the guardianship authority) or a notarized permission for the child to leave the country is necessary for departure. Additionally, the original birth certificate of the child, their international passport if available, and the identity document of the adult will be required.

In Poland, the rules for transporting children in cars in 2024 require the use of child car seats for children shorter than 150 cm, regardless of age. This means that even teenagers up to 17 years old who are shorter than 150 cm must use a car seat or an appropriate restraint system. 

Exceptions to this rule:

Children with a height from 135 to 150 cm: If it is impossible to select a suitable restraint device due to the child's weight and height, it is allowed to transport them in the back seat, secured with the car's standard seat belt. 

Transporting three children: If there are already two car seats installed in the back seat and it is not possible to install a third one, it is allowed to transport a third child over 3 years old, secured with the car's seat belt. 

Medical indications: In the presence of a medical certificate confirming the impossibility of using a car seat due to the child's health condition. 

Prohibited:

Transporting children under 3 years old in vehicles not equipped with seat belts and a car seat. 

Installing a car seat on the front seat facing backward with an active airbag. 

Starting September 2024, only car seats that comply with the new ECE R129 (i-Size) standard, which is based on the child's height and provides stricter safety requirements, are allowed to be sold in Poland. However, the use of car seats of the ECE R44/04 standard is allowed for another 8 years. 

Violation of child transport rules in Poland may result in a fine of 300 zlotys for each child transported without an appropriate restraint device.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: There is such assistance, but there are certain nuances.

According to Polish legislation, assistance to citizens of Ukraine who have arrived in Poland due to military actions is regulated by the Act of March 12, 2022, 'On Assistance to Citizens of Ukraine in Connection with the Armed Conflict on the Territory of that State.'

Article 12 of this Act defines the forms of social assistance that citizens of Ukraine can receive.

Paragraphs 17‚Äì17d of this article establish the following:

Paragraph 17: The Voivode and other authorized bodies may provide the assistance mentioned in paragraph 1 of Article 12 for no longer than 120 days from the day of the first entry of a citizen of Ukraine into the territory of Poland.

Paragraph 17a: After 120 days from the first entry, obtaining assistance requires having a PESEL number and covering 50% of the cost of assistance (not more than 40 zlotys per person per day). For minors receiving upbringing assistance, this amount is 15 zlotys per person per day.

Paragraph 17b: After 180 days from the first entry, obtaining assistance requires having a PESEL number and covering 75% of the cost of assistance (not more than 60 zlotys per person per day). For minors receiving upbringing assistance, this amount remains 15 zlotys per person per day.

Paragraph 17c: The above restrictions do not apply to citizens of Ukraine who:

have a disability certificate or a medium or significant degree of disability;

are 60 years (women) or 65 years (men);

pregnant women or persons raising a child under 12 months;

persons caring for three or more children;

minors for whom a temporary guardian is appointed.

Paragraph 17f: The Voivode may release individuals in difficult life situations from participating in the costs of assistance based on humanitarian considerations.

Therefore, after 120 days of staying in Poland, citizens of Ukraine must partially cover the costs of the provided assistance, except for those who fall into the categories mentioned in paragraph 17c.

To be exempted from payment due to a difficult life situation, a corresponding application must be submitted to the Voivode through the organization providing assistance.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: Is it allowed to park a car with an internal combustion engine in such a place? It intuitively seems that it is not, but it's constantly occupied and the city guard ignores them.
It says there are two places for charging electric cars
The guard will not write a mandate until someone complains
The guardian acts independently of complaints.
Not allowed. Only for electricians and only during charging.
Why should they figure it out? Green plates - electric, white - not electric.
It's frustrating, I stood next to it but didn't leave 1.5 meters (even though there was a bike path) and got a warning, while these ones are parked in electric spots 30 meters away - nothing ü•≤
Although the fine for an electric spot is supposedly higher üôÉ the budget is not being efficiently replenished
It seems like the same fine. But I don't remember exactly.

Good evening! I will tell you the continuation of the story about calling the ambulance for a leg fracture. The ambulance took him to the emergency room and the paramedics waited until the man was admitted. The fracture turned out to be serious and required surgery. The foot was slightly twisted to the side. The operation with the pin was done the same day. The next day the man was discharged. And as a result - no bill was issued. Neither for the ambulance nor for the hospital.

Well, as I said, an ambulance won't just go for no reason. If they went, it means it's serious.

Get well soon.
Thank you!

Most likely, because the fracture turned out to be serious, the call for an ambulance was justified, so they didn't charge a fee. In any case, I'm glad they didn't charge. Wishing the man a speedy recovery! Thank you for sharing your experience!
By the way, did you notice which letter was on the ambulance? A big red letter in a red circle? T, R, S, or P?
No, I didn't even know that they come with different letters

These are different types of ambulances. T - transport. There are paramedics and minimal equipment. R - basic. A basic variant with a doctor and a paramedic. They will go if there is a threat to life or health, but nothing particularly serious. R - this is a resuscitation on wheels stuffed with everything that can be packed into a van and doctors of the highest qualification. S - special. There are two paramedics and a psychiatrist. But they also work with neurology and delirium.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: Oh, interesting. I'll be watching the ambulance closely now.) It's also possible that the ambulance arrived because the Polish person explained the situation. If we had requested it with our basic Polish, it's not a fact that it would have come. Very grateful to him.
Thanks to the Pole, of course, for the help. It's just that the transport has probably arrived. That's why it took 20 minutes - not very urgently.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: Even such a miracle rides in Warsaw. It will get into any nook.
Tell me, I need to buy a gift in Warsaw and maybe someone will be going there and can buy it, of course not for free.
What exactly do I need to buy and where? I'm currently in Warsaw, but I'm a bit busy, so I'm asking what and where, i.e., if I can make it in time.
